Articles.Content:
Since very recently, I have the problem that when staging, two radial decouplers that should stage at the same time are not staging at the same time.

I tried this using the two stock radial decouplers and the hydraulic manifold.

To illustrate this, I have made a small vessel (stock parts) having 2 radial decouplers with an SRB attached to a center core. These two decouplers are placed using symmetry options:

Start

After staging first time

After staging second time

When taking a look in the debug log I see however NullReferenceExceptions occuring...

Screenshot of debuglog

The mods I have installed are (list taken from GameData folder):

- editorextensions

- RasterPropMonitor

- KAS

- KerbalEngineer

- KerbQuake

- NearFutureProps

- NearFutureSolar

- NearFutureSpacecraft

- ProceduralFairings

- RadialEngineMountsPPI (These do work fine!)

- StationScience

- TacFuelBalancer

- Trajectories

- TransferWindowPlanner_1.1.0.0

- KAC

This bug is of course not a showstopper but can be quite annoying during ascent.

Edited December 7, 2014 by Jenteb07
solved
Hi, I think you have our same problem here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102088-Realism-Overhaul-Staging-Issue

Hi, I think you have our same problem here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102088-Realism-Overhaul-Staging-Issue

Hmm yes you're right, probably overlooked this topic...
By looking at the topic you gave, I saw that someone else had this problem while also having KerbQuake installed. I removed KerbQuake and everything works fine now

Sorry, to bring this topic back to life, but I do experience the same problem without having Realism Overhaul or Kerbquake installed. Were you able to solve your problem?

PS: Happy new year guys!
